text: The Stadio Leonardo Garilli is a multi-use stadium in Piacenza, Italy. It is currently used mostly for football matches and the home of Piacenza Calcio 1919 and from 2014 also those of Pro Piacenza 1919.Piacenza e Pro Piacenza: c'è l'accordo per il Garilli Sportpiacenza.it The stadium was built in 1969 and was renovated in 1993 passing from 12,000 to the current 21,668 when the former Piacenza were promoted. The Stadium used to be called 'Galleana' after the area of the city in which it is situated but currently named after Leonardo Garilli (died on 30 December 1996), to whom the city and fans are highly grateful because of his dedication and competence showed when he was the president of the former Piacenza. ==References== ==External links== * Stadium information Stadium Leonardo Garilli Leonardo Piacenza Category:Sports venues in Emilia-Romagna Category:Sports venues completed in 1969 Category:1969 establishments in Italy
